intro: Requienia obcordata, commonly known as the heartleaf begonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant thrives in warm, humid environments and prefers well-draining soil. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms. Requienia obcordata is a member of the Begoniaceae family, which includes many species with similar horticultural value.
